CatDescriptText: John W. McIntyre, salesman, Fifth Ward, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, October 21, 1961, pg. 7 with question: "Do you think that men should marry women within their own age bracket (not over fiver years difference) or do you approve of 'May and December' marriages?" answer reads: "I believe in a difference in age of between 10 and 15 years, because a man, in this case, does not disappoint because he's a man of experience."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of John W. McIntyre wearing pinstriped suit jacket, beard, and hat, standing in front of building with large arched entryway and ribbed metal wall
